website_summaries.verdict: Half the price of other squat racks without sacrificing quality.
pros: Steel construction and 3-step powder coat for superior durability and safety

website_summaries.verdict: This budget-priced half rack is a good fit for small spaces and beginners. However, the low weight capacity can be limiting if your primary passion is weightlifting.
pros: Adjustable bar catches can be used for a variety of lifts
Overhead pull-up bar is made of high-quality tubular stainless steel for added stability
Compact design doesn’t require much space
cons: Maximum weight capacity is only 300 pounds

customer_reviews.title: perfect for what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is quickly becoming one of my favorite purchases. It is exactly what I was looking for—a free-standing pull-up bar where I can practice static pullups, levers, toes-to-bar, and attach suspended training elements. I would not kip on this bar (I don't kip anyway) unless you do something to stabilize the bottom. I also don't lift weights so I can't speak to how useful this item is for that purpose. But for what I wanted to do, it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: A great investment
customer_reviews.text: This is a very affordable home rack, for the money you can't go wrong, I bench press, squat, shoulder press, weighted pull ups, ring dips, you name it, I've done it on this thing totally worth getting, the only thing is the top part will move a little if you are trying to do muscle ups or any kind of kipping moves.
customer_reviews.author: M C

customer_reviews.title: After some modifications, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job well. It would be nice of cap to make additional rack pins available though. I made my own using some pipe and washers from Home Depot and it works really well now! I found the instructions online and did something similar. Do a youtube search for DIY Rack Pins Cap Squat Rack for instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wakim

customer_reviews.title: Solid stuff
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. I saw mixed reviews on this and as I thought, people just don't know how to assemble it. Do not use the meek sized tools provided. You will never get the nuts tight enough. Just an FYI, this is supposed to be bolted to a cement floor. You can easily get away without doing that but you will have some wobble on the stand if you go swinging yourself on it. I use this mainly for hanging upside down to decompress my back so I swing up and it can wobble some....I did not bolt it to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable product for a great price. I bought this because I got caught with no equipment at home for the “stay home stay safe” extended stay. I bought some sandbags off Amazon, made some weights, bought this, and along with a cheap amazon bench, I’m golden. I’ve squatted in this, bench pressed, and done pull-ups. I’m bout 5’10”, 220 pounds. And feel totally confident working with this. Took a little extra time to get here with the circumstances, but we’ll worth it. I used a battery impact for assembling it, so it went quick. Simple instructions, completely intact on arrival. Couldn’t be more impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, Metal bent within first use
customer_reviews.text: This was so much work to build and then after doing 5 pull-ups and 5 hanging leg raises the metal literally started to bend where the beams meet and at the top by the handlebar (I'm 6'0 and 165 lbs....). I wouldn't risk my life using this and I DO NOT believe the weight limit is 300lbs. Total headache and waste of an afternoon building and then disassembling it to return. AVOID
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts; Challenging to construct; Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Missing hardware, so I have to wait “48 business hours” for a response. No answer to the phone call. {Update, the burden of proof is on you to prove you bought it with multiple pictures - just to get missing parts) You’ll use a hex wrench and a socket wrench (or the cheap stamped tool) to install 22 pins. Manufacturing tolerances left much to be desired on hex-fit. This installation could have been cut in half by using squared bolts/slots, but hey I bought this to work out... Mostly frustrated that I have to wait at least a week to actually use it.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: SNAFU  Two left feet  The base beams should have a right and left foot - BUT NO
customer_reviews.text: Started assembling and found the base beams were identical with screw down tabs on the left side on both. That is looking from the rear, both tabs on left. To assemble, will need to turn one side upside down wit tabs on the upper part of the base beam, a hazard to users. If the supplier does not send correct beam, will have to saw off the tabs on one side. That will not be nice. If they come through, will upgrade rating, if not, it is what it is. They don't answer their phone, ugh ! Sent email form, will see.
customer_reviews.author: Wilzer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect rack, just what I needed! It was the last thing I needed for my garage gym to be complete. It’s great size, I’m 5’11” 225 and I’m doing kipping pull ups. Great rack, way better than I expected. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Vega

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces, No Help From Cap Barbell At All!!
customer_reviews.text: Help!!!! I am missing 14 crucial pieces of this set to put it together. In the photo, I am missing all of the pieces marked with a purple dot. I have been calling the Cap Barbell home office for two days & left messages. No one has responded to me! What am I supposed to do with a bunch of metal that I cannot even put together? My review would be higher if they would help me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M T A

customer_reviews.title: Multiple uses and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great. Easy to assemble and really sturdy. I throw my unused weights on the stand and it doesn’t move at all. I am 5’11 and weigh 185 bench around 210 and clips have no issues. I can do pull ups, leg lifts, squats, bench, decline, incline and it does not move. I figured I would bolt it down but there is actually no need. I would recommend this to anyone and it gets complements from neighbor on the looks.
customer_reviews.author: benny martinez

customer_reviews.title: Serious crack
customer_reviews.text: There was a serious crack on the product when it's arrived. I want refund it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easy an fast can easily be used for squats,pull-ups,bench press, shoulder press, i even got a dip attachment to fit i would recommend this to anyone into fitness best of all it wont break the bank!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Best $130 I’ve ever spent on a fitness product
customer_reviews.text: Easy and fast to install! For under $130, you can bench, squat and pullups, basically all you need to get through this pandemic. The cons are when you work with moderate weights, it can shake for a little but I don’t think it would tip over. Also, the J hooks are a little bit rough on the barbell. But for $130, you’re not going to find a better product than this rack. 5 star buy for me! Update: still going strong but my if you are going bench press, use a cheap barbell, otherwise it will knock off the paint. Going to lower it to 4 star because it ruined my barbell
customer_reviews.author: Dan To

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Should have paid closer attention to the bad reviews. I had to purchase my own nuts and bolts to assemble the equipment, the ones that came were too long and would not tighten. I do not recommend anyone buy this. Spend a bit more and get something higher quality. Edit: I am changing my review. This is a great piece of equipment for the price. There was a single stripped bolt and it angered me when putting the rack together. After inspecting all the pieces, I got another bolt from the hardware store, I assembled it and it's working great, I'm going to buy a second one for my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack/Pull-up Bar for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was on sale for $115 but normally over $200. This thing is rock solid and very easy to assemble. Great rack for squats, bench press, shoulder press etc. But best is for pull-ups! I wanted a little more height on it so I put it on top of some solid masonry bricks and strapped them in. Now it’s got the perfect height and great foundation to hold it steady. Took a month to get but for $115 this thing will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Henvir26

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was perfect for my garage gym during this Covid craziness. I’m an avid powerlifter and very particular about my equipment. I didn’t want to spend a ton of money. Just something I could use to bench and squat with. Hits the mark for me.
customer_reviews.author: #honest

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you actually plan to do pull-ups this isn’t the set for you. Easy to assemble, however the support between the upper and lower vertical bars is pathetic. After one session I’m not using this again until I can reinforce this area further. This is an extremely weak area and you will experience flexing while you perform pull-ups. Also the included bolts are cheap, they will strip very easily when fighting down. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, welds will break over time.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about two months before crapping out. Used it for kipping pull-ups and it worked well (needed to weigh it down with sandbags) but now the inner bracket that connects the bottom piece to the top is loose, so the entire thing wobbles regardless of how much weight is on the base. Probably a crappy weld. That's what I get for not going with rogue.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jhonson

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but why too cheap to include lower hooks?
customer_reviews.text: Okay for what it is, but you would think those geniuses at Cap would include two more hooks for the bottom. They couldn't just charge 10 more bucks more and include them? Gotta wonder what goes on upstairs... However, here's a great fix. Buy two 6" by 5/8 inch hex lag bolts. You can actually screw them in through the holes for a nice, snug fit, and the bold ends won't let the bar roll off. They work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A L Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Great for pull ups and gymnastic rings
customer_reviews.text: I use my pull up bar for pull ups and gymnastic rings. I would recommend athletic tape for the grip if you want to really see any results with pull ups. If it seems unstable, just screw the nuts and bolts tighter and fixes the issue quickly. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Samson Selleck

customer_reviews.title: Got an Impact drill.
customer_reviews.text: Let's start in. Does it do what its used for? Absolutely. Is it it easy to setup? Not too bad. Is it stable? Not just no but ____ no. If you have an impact drill and a bit of time, then this is for you. It's not a design flaw or anything, I would never say that. However, if you try to use this thing with a TRX... you will find yourself on your behind. I have four olympic plates totaling 100 lbs on the one side, and still it wants to fall over at the slightest hint of weight. If you buy it, be prepared to anchor it before use.
customer_reviews.author: Firewalker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This rack is perfect for my needs. I use it for my squat and bench rack. It has a max weight listed of 500, which is fine for me. I'm not putting more than 200 on it for my lifting purposes, if that. You can also use it as a pull up bar. I'm 5'1" and 160lbs and it doesn't move at all when I do assisted pull ups or ab work hanging from the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect answer for covid lockdown gym closures
customer_reviews.text: Covid-19 has taught the world that you do not need a gym membership to stay in shape. Bought this because of lockdown/shelter in place- plan on canceling my gym membership now. Assembly of this product was easy- took less than an hour. Product is extremely sturdy. No wobble whatsoever. Great height on pullup bar. Attractive rack, does not take up much space. Low price, definitely worth every penny. Wish I would have bought it sooner, but I never imagined we’d be locked out of gyms over 2 months now. This is a must for your home gym.
customer_reviews.author: RichinNYC

customer_reviews.title: More Fun Than I Thought It Would Be
customer_reviews.text: CAP produces excellent equipment. The parts are easy to fit together and are well finished. While it will take me sometime to really work myself up to full use of this piece of equipment, the convenience of having will be incentive. I have lost weight recently and have decided to develop upper body strength and as far as my research goes there are three basic exercises I should do proficiently: (1) push ups, (2) pull ups -- and this is why I got the Power Rack and, (3) squat thrusts. As a recent retiree my goal this first year -- and I am 71 -- is to get as physically healthy as I possibly can.
customer_reviews.author: Larry G. Bierman

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is not for you, unless you're looking for a puzzle to try to put together and then take apart again. Lots of things were missing from the package. If quality control is that bad, do you trust the integrity of the equipment? Also, simply assembling the bars left metal flakes all over; they were wedged under my fingernails and in my skin. Not worth it, my fellow shoppers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for the money. This is not a cage nor is it bolted on the floor so no muscle ups or kipping. I’ve had 405 on the rack & ZERO issues with it. The slot for the barbell came lose & broke after two weeks. It would be better to have 2 pegs for weights instead of a peg for weights & a slot for the barbell
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control. Nuts and bolts don't work.
customer_reviews.text: Can't put together with the nuts and bolts provided. They're too long and won't tighen. I have to spend more money to put this together. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Stac79

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Easy to Put Together
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sturdy, yet very easy to put together. I am one person, 5’ tall, and I was able to build the stand without additional help! Being sturdy, it also supports what I need to do for basic aerial yoga. I was super unsure if it would be too much because I AM overweight, but I’m able to hang the trapeze, and rock in it. I highly recommend it if you're on the fence!
customer_reviews.author: Toast

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rack for the garage!
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy assemble - it took only an hour at most (if you have the right tools). Even though I needed my wife's help to hold certain parts in place while I was tightening up the screws. It says it can hold up to 300lbs. I'm 6'9" 235 dude. Doing pull ups is a bit challenging due to my height, but it is doable (without swinging). As for the barbell, it held 185lbs without any wobbling. I would recommend for folks who do not lift too heavy. As for my tall brothers, if you are 7 foot or taller - too bad! You might need to look for some other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: StorasG

customer_reviews.title: Great but not as solid as hoped
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is great quality for pull-ups (I don't use it for weightlifting). The only complaint is that, as some others have noted, it isn't the most stable item. I tried doing some headbangers the day I got it and it started rocking. I also tried hanging some bands from it and doing a couple of lat pulldowns and discovered that the bands can go more than about 30 degrees from vertical. Also, muscle ups can only be done if you are strict, no kipping, no swinging and go straight up and down. If you bolt it to the floor, however, this would be a solid piece of equipment (which is what I will probably do).
customer_reviews.author: Fiziksphreak

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack and fits Rogue weight plate holders.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid rack. Easy to assemble and I’ve had no issues with it. By the way, if anyone is looking for weight plate holders that fit the 3/8 holes on this rack, the ROGUE SP2250 PLATE STORAGE PAIR - LONG FOR MASS STORAGE works great. They’re the only ones I’ve found that actually fit this rack and the fuel performance squat rack. Basically, any 2x2 weight plate holder with 0.5 inch holes/screws will fit this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 weeks to receive the item, and then one of the parts was bent preventing proper assembly. When I contacted customer service no one answered, I then emailed and got a run around. Additionally, it was showing signs of rust after only a couple of weeks. so be aware if you are in a humid environment. Poor quality control, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great little squat rack. Very solid. Easy to put together. Well worth the price. I see people complaining about tools and setup. If you have a socket it is super quick. I am 6’4” 235lbs and it can do pull ups and knee ups on it. Can’t say it’s stable for kipping pull-ups but it’s not a full cage so I would not expect it to be. I am not an Olympic weightlifter but for my teenage boys and I it is perfect. I have only had about 350lbs on it and it worked fine. Perfect for the garage gym.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Else

customer_reviews.title: I purchased some TRX type of straps and they are working out great attached to the bar
customer_reviews.text: Ok, for this I will write a short review. This piece of equipment is solid, not difficult to set up, and can't beat this price. I am about 215-220 pounds and have no issues with stability doing pull ups. I purchased some TRX type of straps and they are working out great attached to the bar, but I will have to get some 45lb plates to adequately stabilize the base for some exercises. I have not yet found a bar, but eventually I'll use it to do squats and some overhead press exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Should be bolted down for any explosive bar movements
customer_reviews.text: It's great for lifting but requires a 7 foot Oly bar, 6 foot bars are too narrow to fit on the J-Hooks properly. I love the ease of adjustment but would have preferred two different facing J-hooks as they are more stable when the solid part is facing center. Easy to assemble by one person, just needed a ratchet wrench. Overall it's a great deal for the price. As far as the stability, I placed heavy rocks on the base to do kipping pullups but if indoors, I'd have bolted into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Xandir's mom

customer_reviews.title: Love my Rack--but dont need any help from CAP--terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of CAP products-- recently moved--and several smaller parts went missing in the move --my fault or movers-- no problem, I will order replacement parts from CAP-- Dang--it is easier to get Trump to quit tweeting than to get a live customer service rep at CAP--no worries- CAP will do it by email--they just will never actually send you an email that is helpful or allows you to replace the parts--note I am not asking them to replace for free---I want to purchase the replacement parts Again great product--I should have been able to order the missing parts--
customer_reviews.author: forrest c wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I got this a few days ago and assembled it quickly because I wanted to use it quickly. I have a small bar, 5ft, Olympic 2 inch. I do not have your normal 7ft. I elected short because of my height. So far I’m happy with this purchase and worth the price. I got plate holders on the side and happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: moomers197

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I wrote a very long, detailed review offering some advice to potential buyers, but it was refused. Basically, nuts and bolts don't match the other parts, BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value! Bought for aerial yoga.
customer_reviews.text: Although the package came damaged and missing a few washers (I easily replaced at Home Depot), this was relatively easy to set up. I did use my own ratchet set because the included tool didn't allow me to tighten the screws as much as was necessary. I bought this to hang an aerial yoga swing. The side bars do limit the range of motion, but it works well with inversions. I adapted most of my stretches to keep the weight under the bar and it works well. The stand would likely tip if swinging too much. I will eventually weigh it down with sandbags to do more angled exercises, but for now, I feel very comfortable with this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner rack
customer_reviews.text: A very nice beginner power rack for any home gym on a budget. If you have more money you obviously want to spend a little more but this is still a rack well worth your money. The overall quality is good, the metal feels quite sturdy, and the assembly doesnt take longer than 45ish minutes. My only complaints are that the red hooks that hold the bar are rubbing flakes of red paint onto the bar and that when doing pull ups the rack can feel like its a little unstable but honestly nothing that would endanger someone.
customer_reviews.author: Corterri

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable value for price
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and it seems to work however there's no way I would trust it near it's maximum rated weight. Some of the metal segments were bent and so the entire rack is slightly bent which doesn't have any functional impact but does annoy me. Also the welds look terrible and there's already a bit of rust on the inside of some of the segments. This is acceptable for the low price I paid for this but I'm not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Non-existent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The rack is what you'd expect for $120. It wobbles a bit and is made of thin steel, but it does allow me to do pull-ups and rings at 197 lbs BW and holds a barbell. The problem is I've called the customer service line over ten times at different times of the day and absolutely no one answers. I'm trying to order an extra Olympic plate pin to replace the barbell holder so I can counterweight the rack evenly. No one answers the phone, no matter what extension you dial. It is rediculous. I've even left messages and no return call. Would not buy from Cap again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: K. Midstokke

customer_reviews.title: The assembly was rather easy as the instructions are broken down in multiple languages ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a non-conventional use, hanging from a yoga trapeze. The assembly was rather easy as the instructions are broken down in multiple languages and the images are clear, even providing an exploded view of the assembly. I purchased two and the assembly time was around 3 hours total with the second one only taking half and hour. The device itself is well made and weighted nicely. It even allows for additional weight to be added to the frame through the placement of weights, that is what you are seeing in the photo towards the rear of the device. An added benifit if this is an option for you, you can bolt the device to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Got this for the pullup bar
customer_reviews.text: My doorframes can't handle the mounted pull up bars. This was my only alternative. The floor in my porch is extremely uneven so I had to add cardboard padding under one of the legs. Its extremely stable during pull ups and chin ups. Do yourself the favor and invest in your health. I bought this and some other calisthenics equipment to make a cheap at home gym. Having this makes me feel motivated and I no longer have any excuses to continue slacking. This was a great investment p.s I recommend using your own tools to tighten the screws or it will be awkward (but its doable)
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good for home use. During summers we have three people every week day use it. Fits well in a garage and doesn't take up too much space. Will not fit the smaller barbell, until I cut down the width. Only issue is spot where the risers meet. To keep it from moving at bolted section, you have to tighten enough to defflect frame. Solid spacer or sleeve would be nice. I also reinforced pull up bar and inserted with heavier bar. But it saved money and time over other options. Would not be afraid to use as is.
customer_reviews.author: Skot Grenland

customer_reviews.title: It’s perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Took about an hour to assemble, I recommend using your own tools instead of the cheap ones provided or it may take longer. Everything was easy and perfectly fit together. I understand this is beginner quality equipment but I’m a beginner! Very happy
customer_reviews.author: mada989

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described -- HOME USE equipment
customer_reviews.text: It's solid and stable enough I don't worry about it. Doing pull ups can be a little shaky but not enough to mess up your form or be scary. I put it on rubber mats. It's used 8-14 times/week. The heaviest weights we've put on it so far is 180 lbs. but there is no difference in how the rack reacts to that or 60 lbs. It also doesn't take up very much room in my garage. I recommend this to anyone looking to add military press and/or squats to a home workout and not wanting to spend crazy money for a big build out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a good addition to your home gym
customer_reviews.text: Four stars instead of five because mine arrived missing the back pegs (that hold plates and the bar) which was a huge selling point for me. But that unpleasantness aside I'm glad I purchased this standing rack. Initially I looked at free standing individual racks but am so glad I didn't purchase them. This is sturdy enough for home use (we aren't lifting 300+lbs over here...yet, hee hee) and I don't have to worry about it tipping over when re-racking. Its perfect for the area we needed it to fit in (the full cages are just too big). Shipped/received fast and put together easily. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: KDixon

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for any home gym
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and offers a lot of versatility without taking up a lot of space. Bench press, squat rack, pull up bar, resistance band training and more. Holds a decent amount of weight for safe use for most people although I would suggest buying the safety catch arms if you don't have a spotter. Not as sturdy as a cage but that is expected having only 2 posts. Overall excellent quality, construction and versatility. I'd recommend this to anybody who is a beginner or intermediate bench press or squat rack user.
customer_reviews.author: Shaz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Rack, Hard Assembly
customer_reviews.text: The price for it is good. It comes with a pull-up attachment and even when doing pull-ups the rack won’t sway. I’m a competitive powerlifter and I can say this rack is definitely good at handling heavy weight 405+ but the assembly was hard. Not only did it come with bad bolts, the instructions weren’t as clear. I had to go to a Lowe’s Store and Purchase 3 different Replacement bolts but besides that it’s worth buying
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Functional power rack
customer_reviews.text: It works well for what I need in setting up my home gym in a tiny space. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great pull up bar at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: A very solid product at a fair price. Once erected it feels fairly sturdy. Depending on your situation you can even reinforce it to the ground. I highly recommend a small adjustable wrench. You may have difficulty trying to use their wrench tool. I also found that if you are doing this solo you will need to have one hand on the Allen wrench to keep the screw/bolt in place while you tighten the nut on the other end. Took me just over an hour to construct solo, mainly due to taking very close precaution to ensure the alignment was right.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ferrer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for minimalist home gym
customer_reviews.text: It's actually pretty stable for holding hundreds of pounds and using for pull-ups. Seems well made. I assembled it with the tools provided in about 4 hours - probably would have been faster had I used a socket wrench. I actually think I prefer the minimalist design, over a full 4-column power rack; it gives me more space to work with in my already cramped bedroom. And at $120, you're saving yourself boo koo bucks over alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good for pull-ups, hanging leg raises for abs and not good nor safe for trx
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this power rock for chinups, wide grip pull-ups and hanging abs crunches and it works pretty well. My only problem is that the grip bar on top could be a little thicker and I wish it hand multiple hand variations for neutral, hamer grip positioning. Also worth noting that using trx is not acceptable nor safe to do so as power rack being pulled will trx can bend do a side.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, pretty solid for a cheaper rack
customer_reviews.text: Very simple rack to assemble, pullup bar is solid as well, it's a bit shaky doing pullups but nothing to be concerned about. Holds weight well but would recommend putting sand bags or something heavy on the back side if lifting heavy because it will wobble just a bit. But all in all would definitely recommend this for a home gym setup, just make sure you do your measurements right when considering this rack because it's not height adjustable. Min is pushing 4yrs old and it's still holding strong
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Otto

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price
customer_reviews.text: The squat rack is certainly a good buy for the price that it's offered at. I definitely would be wary of putting more than 300 lbs on here. Caution also needs to be taken to rerack your weight softly. The rack can move quite a bit. I have tried putting weights on the legs which has helped the stability and prevent rocking. Overall I say this is great for beginners and the small home gym. Anyone looking to lift more than 300 lbs should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this rack, especially at it’s price. Unless you’re a professional body builder or power lifter who needs something more heavy duty, this is all you need. It is quite stable, adjustable, can be used as a bench press, squat rack and you can do all sorts of different compound excercises with it. Very good product for the price, I’ll save money and time in the long run using a home gym instead of a membership.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: bolts in one upright dont line up/non-existant customer service
customer_reviews.text: good price, but you get what you pay for. box came extremely damaged. Plate holder part was cracked. (this piece is not critical), however Bolts for one upright will not line up, cannot put bolt thru hole. i have been waiting for 4 weeks for replacement parts which customer service said were shipped. now customer service will not respond to any of my emails. got tired of waiting for parts so had to drill own holes. seems decent, sturdy if you have weights on both sides of rack. Really need to improve customer service. gave 2 stars for price only, customer service would be zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get yourself a 17mm socket wrench before assembling
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine today. Took me maybe an hour or two to assemble. I couldn't figure out how they wanted you to tighten with the included hex wrench (mini) and an adjustable wrench. The nuts tighten with a 17mm socket pretty easily. Mine is for pull-ups and seems to work fine. It's on our outside wood deck for now and didn't screw it down but I could.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Liser

customer_reviews.title: Great, Simple Squat Rack...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic squat rack/pull-up bar for the price. It is sturdy enough to handle at least 225lbs (so far) and fits nicely in our garage. Took about an hour to install with the allen wrench that it comes with. The J-hooks paint rubs off slightly on the bar but they are incredibly easy to adjust. Wish the pull-up bar was 6 inches higher, I’m 6’0, because my feet touch at the bottom of the pull-up, but it’s much better than doing pull-ups in the doorway.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this purchase. I have a small gym area in my garage and I was looking for a versatile piece of equipment that took up little space. This is perfect. It was easy to assemble and is sturdy. My only complaint is that barbell hooks arrived with chipped paint. I contacted the company and they sent me a new sent. I’m sure I will scuff them up during use, but I felt they should be undamaged upon delivery. I gave four stars due to the difficulty I experienced trying to contact the company for the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: H.P.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. The back posts can't both hold plates only the one on the right. The one on the left is designed to hold a barbell which is nice, not a criticism but I was hoping I could put plates on both sides for stability. J-Cups are awful. They run red paint off on your bar and they're not padded with rubber or anything so also wears your bar. Evaluated alone I don't think I would recommend this. It I got it for slightly more than a 45lb plate cost while it was on sale so for that it's great! If nothing else you can put some rings on it and just use it for pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It’s a strong, sturdy squat rack. It’s not fancy or flashy, just a basic squat rack for exercising.
customer_reviews.text: I loved that I could get a squat rack and bench press in my home gym for under $300. As long as you’re on a flat surface, the rack is very firm and strong. The pull up bar is only 8ft, but is very good for pull ups. If you have your own tools it’s easier to set up, just don’t tighten too much on the ends or it’ll bend the metal. Compared to titan and rogue racks, this was a very good bang for your buck. A great value if you just have your own little workout space.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Squat Rack for Garage Gym
customer_reviews.text: I am starting to build my garage gym and I needed a squat rack. I came across this and for the price I thought it was good. It is great! Very durable and steady. You cannot do kipping pull ups but you can do banded or strict pull ups. Easy to move around the garage. The unit weighs 75 pounds and I have no problem picking it up and putting it at the back of the garage when so I can pull my car back in.
customer_reviews.author: Evie Kevish

customer_reviews.title: Great value and design
customer_reviews.text: I look into CAP for affordable and quality products. My expecatations were not the greatest as I was expecting this to hold the barbell for bench press and squats. To my surprise this item is sturdy and well made, will hold us for pull ups without jiggling. Only thing I'd watch out for is that the barbell plate stopper matches or exceeds the width of the unit, otherwise the bar won't rest on holders.
customer_reviews.author: Syzokel (Itacv2)

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for beginner lifters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put in my garage so I can start getting into weight lifting. It’s a great purchase. I am 200lbs and can do pull ups on this without any issues, and the rack is also sturdy for beginners. I have put up to 225lbs on rack without any issues. I’d be a little nervous if you’re lifting 300lbs+. The assembly takes some time and is manageable, but is much easier if you have someone to help.
customer_reviews.author: Aamir

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4", and weigh 250 lb. I use the rack primarily for pullups, and it holds my weight well. It is very stable - not rock solid like a pullup bar fixed into the ground, but it feels completely safe to use. I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Simms

customer_reviews.title: Great BUT will be bad for squatting if you're <5'4" (162cm)!
customer_reviews.text: The rack has been great for my squats, benches, overhead presses, inverse rows, pull-ups/dead hangs, and I even use it for some ballet barre exercises. However, if you're under 5'4" the optimal place to put the J-Hooks for squatting will be right where the side supports have their two halves attached (so you can't use the holes). I'm 5'4" and wish I could place the hooks a bit lower, but can survive where its at. If you're any shorter, I imagine you'd have to be on your tippie toes to unrack which is just unsafe - especially when lifting heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Really cheap for a versatile squat rack that will get the job done. Packaging wasn’t too heavy or oversized. Decently sturdy, I was able to load 225lb so far. Cons: Instructions could be better. Assembly is kind of a b*tch. I suggest you use pliers or a wrench if you have one because the one Hex key they give you isn’t going to do much. No safety catchers, you have to buy them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Great for home gym during social distancing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack for the price. It does have some wobbling, but it's sturdy enough for workouts. Easy to assemble and doesn't take too much space. Overall good purchase, perfect for home use until the gyms open up.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Yoga Swing Stand
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with my yoga trapeze swing. East simple instructions to assemble, works great for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Davis

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit most accessories
customer_reviews.text: Will not fit most rack equipment. The holes are 1/2" while beams are 2"x2". See any other rack accessory equipment with those specs? Where to buy j-hooks? The metal is sturdy but obviously but easily bends when bolts are tightened. I definitely regret buying this instead of something that has more equipment available. I have to build my own accessories :-(
customer_reviews.author: Alina Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to start-up my home gym during the COVID-19 pandemic. For the low price this rack gets the job done. I workout 5-6 times a week intensely--no issues as of yet. The rack does have some sway when doing pull ups and re-racking a moderately loaded bar (anything greater than ~135lbs), but this is easily fixed by bolting the rack to the ground or by placing counterweights on its legs and propping it against a wall.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: I’m very happy! I can’t do everything I can do with ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to hang my yoga swing- very solid. My boyfriend used it to do pull-ups when he’s over, and it holds strong as well. This was the most affordable stand for the yoga swing, I’m very happy! I can’t do everything I can do with the yoga swing, but it’s still very good, and it fits in my rather small bedroom, unlike other yoga swing stands I’d looked at. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Yay

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective, but has imperfections
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This product was relatively cost effective, but it's definitely noticed during assembly. A ton of leftover metal was inside some parts and had to be taken out manually. This can be a danger to anyone who doesn't have needle nose pliars. Second, the welds aren't the best either. The pictures show everything. Overall good for starters like myself, but CAP quality control needs to inspect parts better before shipping a finished product.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Medrano

customer_reviews.title: How much weight can it hold really?
customer_reviews.text: First squat rack. Decent price. Confused on weight limit. Amazon descriptions sound like 750-1000 pounds. I know it says for pull up bar and hooks, but it seems like it's advertising one weight, but manufacturer warns not to exceed 300. Makes me skeptical. But this is a starter rack for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gudger

customer_reviews.title: Rusty J hooks, no communication from seller
customer_reviews.text: The J hooks included with the rack were covered in rust dust. The design of the hooks, means that there is no way to reach the interior with a spray coat of any sort, so I can't even try and minimize further rusting. I attempted to get a replacement part, and Amazon directed me to the manufacturers website. It's been over a week, and my request attempt has not even been acknowledged. It seems fairly sturdy, and I'm sure will give some use, but with the rust I'm not sure it's going to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jana MacInnis

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty sturdy but does wobble a little bit and I'm 5ft 4in tall about 120lbs
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with my purchase. The setup took about 40 minutes...although tools are included you'll be better off using your own pliers or wrench. It's pretty sturdy but does wobble a little bit and I'm 5ft 4in tall about 120lbs. It works great for my yoga trapeze yet I wouldn't do too much unless it was bolted to the floor. I'm glad I caught a sale.
customer_reviews.author: DigiReviews

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever customer service and product.
customer_reviews.text: Worst company to deal with. Received packaged with a broken weld. I submitted a warranty claim back in May and I have yet to receive my part. If you call the office , in Texas’s, no one answers and the mail box is conveniently full. Save your money and time and go somewhere else. The worst.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for the price, just wish it had spotters
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, I just wish it had optional spotter arms for purchase. I contacted CAP through the "contact us" link on their website and they never responded to let me know if any of the spotter arms for their other racks will fit. The other people who have commented that this isn't sturdy must not have tightened all of the bolts down sufficiently b/c I'm a big guy and I can do pull-ups from this w/o it bolted down and it doesn't wobble or sway.
customer_reviews.author: whatever

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: - It's difficult to do incline bench press on this thing because there are connecting fasteners that impede you from putting your hooks at the sweet spot. You either have to start out shallow or reach up uncomfortably. - Hard to do seated barbell military presses with an adjustable bench as the back stabilizer bar gets in the way. - trying to get a bar off your back quick will about knock this thing over lol. Be careful quick racking.
customer_reviews.author: RSK2

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, perfect for just doing some pullups. Welds arent that great. no allen wrench.
customer_reviews.text: i needed a freestanding pullup bar and this fits my needs. If you just wanna do pullups this is the bar for you. It comes with the barbell holder and olympic weight spot, but eh. i guess you could put a bench under this and use it in that manner, but it is a pullup bar. mine did not come with the allen wrench to assemble it. and the welds on the thing that would hold a barbell are poor at best.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Covid-19 Gains
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price. I paid $200, overpriced, during this Covid-19 pandemic. Be careful when tightening the screws. A review mentioned it, I had forgotten when I slightly overtightened a nut and yes it bent the steel a bit from the bottom rails. My advice? Be careful when using a drill. Double check the welds, they’re not the best. My j hooks might not handle the 300lb loading capacity. Not sure if I should even try it. Those are probably the two negative things I can say for the rack. So far I’ve done pull ups, bench pressed, squatted, I’ve even committed a sin by doing bicep curls there. Overall, a good rack for what it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We use it daily inside our Marine Corps office, had it for over a year now. Works great to just get up off your desk and hit a few pull ups to stretch your body out during the day. I added 4x4s to the bottom of it with lag screws in order to make it a bit taller, I also drilled holes sideways at the bottom and mounted the bar holders as steps for our shorter Marines (mostly females).
customer_reviews.author: J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: I rate it a 4 because it does seem sturdy, doesn't wobble
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rack over a year ago to prep for my military fitness test. Turns out I became pregnant and just never got to putting it together. A year later and here we finally are. I haven't used it yet, BUT, I rate it a 4 because it does seem sturdy, doesn't wobble, and is overall of decent quality. The bars aren't labeled for assembly, amd even tjpigh it takes a bit longer to figure out what's what, the pictures on the manual are quite easy to follow. Once I get to actually use it I'll update wether the rack is made to last.
customer_reviews.author: eva lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy. Don't use the tools provided use a good socket set. I didn't hook up the barbell holder as I think that is pretty worthless. I stabilized it with (3) 50 lbs dumbbells and a 45 lb weight. I'm 5'9" 220 lbs and can do chin ups on it with no problem. Moves a little but nothing that concerns me. It definitely needs to be stabilized with something if you don't nail it to the ground. I also use bands with no movement. I think it a great buy for the money. If your and advanced weightlifter you"ll probably want a better one but for everyone else I highly recommend this power rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Oh how I love this exercise stand
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I love this exercise stand! I can actually squat much more weight now than I thought I could! And I am doing chin ups that I couldn't do before!! I am still working on pull ups but I am so thankful for this stand. I wish it were slightly shorter only because where I put it, it sits barely below the ceiling (laundry room of basement) but that is not the product's fault. It is VERY sturdy, but don't swing on it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is nice. However, as you can see from the pictures, there's no way to put a bolt through the hole to hold the upper piece to the lower piece. I need this bolt to go through since it will be holding a barbell with heavy weight. Also, one of the locknuts had no threads. I sent the company an email with these pictures March 2, and made a phone call leaving a message March 6. Still have not heard back from anyone. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Harwood

customer_reviews.title: I love this power rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this power rack. It is heavily made and did not take long to put together. I don't know if it would hold up for a powerlifter, but for someone who is 50 like me, it serves my purposes. The red racks are easy to change out and I love the chin-up bar. Very affordable if you are trying to set up your own home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Tim Winters

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: It’s solid enough. Max capacity is 300 pounds, so if you’re aspiring to be a powerlifter this might not be for you, but it’s plenty for me in my garage gym. It has a little side to side wobble but seems not too bad. My only complaint was it arrived in a package that looked beat to heck, and the hardware packaging was torn open. Several washers and a couple nuts were missing. No big deal, I can buy some at Lowe’s. Just expected not to have to.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Missing and Broken Parts
customer_reviews.text: As we began to easily assemble the exercise stand, we realized that one of the upper arms was completely missing, so we could not finish putting it together. Then, we noticed that one of the pieces on the base pole was coming apart at the weld. This could lead to a catastrophe during weight training. I sent 2 emails to the manufacturer, only to get no response. The telephone number displayed goes straight to a FULL VOICEMAIL. Otherwise, the barbell stand seems like it's made from quality material, for the exception of the weld breaking loose. Double check your parts before you begin assembly! :(
customer_reviews.author: Lilshopper

customer_reviews.title: this thing is WAY to tall and there is no way to adjust it lower than 7 feet
customer_reviews.text: 1. It took forever to put together and it was a very tedious process. 2. IT IS WAY WAY TO TALL!!!! with no options for shorter people to lower it. I literally had to build a platform to reach it. 3. it is not stable if it is not bolted into ground. I used sand bags to weigh it down because I cant bolt it down. do yourself a favor and build one for much cheaper . I now wish I would have.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Finding My Item Defected in the Final Stage is a Slap In The Face!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe it! I spent all this time putting this item together, and I’m at the last stages to realize that one of the bars doesn’t have holes punctured through for me to screw together. I waited for this product for over a month, and having to come to a situation where I can’t complete assembly towards the final stages to use is like a slap in the face. I’m very disappointed and disheartened to have had to go through all this for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Good pull up bar.
customer_reviews.text: I used it as a pull up bar works great. Had to use some bags of sand on the base to keep it from moving around. If you are doing more than pull ups I would use bolts to anchor it down. Shipping took a while to arrive but besides that its a good buy
customer_reviews.author: gadget guy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Really impress with this rack, well worth the money. I was skeptical before I ordered but I'm glad I did. Assembly was not difficult and instructions are super easy to follow. The rack allows you to do pull-ups and it feels solid. I use it for bench press as well and no problems there. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hieght, I can can jump up to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hieght, I can can jump up to do T2B and kipping pull-ups. It’s grounded by the bumper plates i have on the storage post. I plan on putting my yoga swing on here as well. It only holds up to 300 pounds which is fine because I’m not squatting over 300 pounds just yet. I think this is perfect for smaller people (I’m a 5’2 150 pound woman). My husband lifts too heavy and is too tall to get good use out of this but it’s perfect for me. Only con is the chipping of red paint which is unimportant to me.
customer_reviews.author: Whitty Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good value and gets the job done but I wouldn’t load tons of weight on it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 year old son. It is a good value for what he needs. Of course not the highest quality but for the price it gets the job done. We don’t put more than 225ish on the rack at a time so it works really well for what we use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing squat stand
customer_reviews.text: I am 5’10 220 and doing pull ups on this stand was good no worries about shaking or tipping. I haven’t done a lot of workouts on it and I only have about 130 pounds of weight so I can’t speak on weight capacity but it looks like it can Hold up 400+. The color on this thing pops and everyone who has seen it in my garage loves it. I put a red suspension on it and it’s a lot better than using a door. Highly recommend this stand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: holds weight, cheap, but will scratch your barbell.
customer_reviews.text: hold weight as long as you don't mind scratching the heck out of the grip on your barbell. you'll have to add rubber or teflon plastics on the J hooks if you want to keep your barbell in good shape. doesn't matter if you don't care about your equipment condition, but I just spent $300 on a decent barbell crossbar not high enough for pull ups unless you're under 5' tall
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Power Rack Exercise Stand
feature_bullets: SPECS: Assembled dimensions are 46 inches wide x 50 inches deep x 85 inches high
MAXIMUM CAPACITY: Maximum weight of user is 500 lbs | Maximum training load is 500 lbs
CONSTRUCTION – The 11- and 12- gauge steel tubing allows this bench to handle heavy weight securely, without compromise
FEATURES: Built in bar and weight storage; Double gusseted uprights provide exceptional stability and security; J cup catches to safely hold barbell
RELIABILITY: Durable powder coat finish and industrial zinc hardware provide exceptional maintenance free durability
TRUST: Trust experience; CAP has been a pioneer in fitness for over 30 years and has locations worldwide; Chances are if you have EVER worked out, you have used a CAP product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
